author: Kex8990
description:
Behaviors
-
Includes two behaviors:
**BuffedCharacter**: Define a series of stats to be buffed. Grant or remove buffs using their predefined values. Also, activate or deactivate abilities. Can have any amount of active buffs and all stats will be calculated applying all buff modifier.

**Buff**: Buffs are temporary effects applied to a character. Buffs can change stats or enable abilities while they are active. They have a default duration, which can be refreshed (or not!). They can be set to stack - the buff effect will be applied multiple times up to an optional limit. 

*Tips and tricks:*
-
 - Manage **other variables** like movement speed, timers, animation speed, size, etc. And change them via buffs.
 - **Abilities** are simple yes/no flags that can be used to enable/disable more specific and complex abilities defined by you. Managing them through the behavior enables them to be flipped on/off by buffs, and also saves you from manually creating variables to track them.
- Give **enemies** the BuffedCharacter behavior and tweak their stats to create levels of difficulty. 
- The Buff behavior has 4 Stats and 2 abilities defined in its properties, to add more, simply follow the naming convention and **add up to 10 abilities and 10 stats**. They will be supported without any code changes!
- If the modifiers are applied in the **undesired order**, for example a x2 buff is applied a before a +10, use the Buff stat order property to control the order in which the modifications are applied.
name: Buffs
shortDescription: Manage buffs which can modify multiple stats, stack up and expire after a certain time.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Define buffable stats for an object, calculates final values after applying all buff modifiers. Additionally stores sprites for a buff to create a buff bar.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: BuffedCharacter

eventsFunctions.description: Add a buff to a character and apply all its modifiers.
eventsFunctions.name: AddBuff

parameters.description: Duration in seconds  (0: Unlimited, -1: Default duration)
parameters.name: DurationOverride

eventsFunctions.description: Activate a character's ability by name. Does not interact with buffs. For example, when a buff that granted the same ability expires, the ability is not removed.
eventsFunctions.name: AddAbilityByName

eventsFunctions.description: Add a stat to be managed by the behavior.
eventsFunctions.name: SetStat
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set _PARAM2_ as a buffable stat of _PARAM0_ with a base value of _PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description: Change a or set a stat. If the stat doesn't exists, it will be created.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeStat

eventsFunctions.description: The amount of time before the buff expires (in milliseconds).
eventsFunctions.name: BuffRemainingTime

eventsFunctions.description: The number of stacks for a buff.
eventsFunctions.name: BuffStackCount

eventsFunctions.description: The value for a given stat using its name.
eventsFunctions.name: Stat

eventsFunctions.description: Check whether an ability is currently active, regardless if it was granted by a buff or manually.
eventsFunctions.name: HasAbility

eventsFunctions.description: Removes an ability. Does not interact with buffs, if the ability was granted by a buff, it'll remain until the buff expires or is removed.
eventsFunctions.name: RemoveAbilityByName

eventsFunctions.description: Remove a buff stack. If it's the last stack, the buff is fully reemoved
eventsFunctions.name: RemoveBuffStack

eventsFunctions.description: Check whether a buff is active.
eventsFunctions.name: HasBuff

eventsFunctions.description: Fully remove a buff and all its stacks.
eventsFunctions.name: RemoveBuff

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Modification to the players stats or abilities.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Buff

eventsFunctions.description: Buff stack limit. Applications of the buff after the limit is reached will not increase the stack.
eventsFunctions.name: StackLimit

propertyDescriptors.label: Refreshable. Subsequent applications refresh the duration.
propertyDescriptors.name: Refreshable

propertyDescriptors.label: Stackable. Subsequent applications stack up.
extraInformation: Singleton. Cannot be reapplied until the duration ends.
Stackable with refresh. Reapplication increases the stack count and refreshes duration.
Stackable without refresh. Reapplication increases the stack count but not the duration.
propertyDescriptors.name: Stackable

propertyDescriptors.label: Stat #1 Name of stat to be changed
propertyDescriptors.name: Stat1Name

propertyDescriptors.label: Stat #1 Order (higher values are applied first)
propertyDescriptors.name: Stat1Priority

propertyDescriptors.label: Stat #2 Name of stat to be changed
propertyDescriptors.name: Stat2Name

propertyDescriptors.label: Stat #2 Order (higher values are applied first)
propertyDescriptors.name: Stat2Priority

propertyDescriptors.label: Stat #3 Name of stat to be changed
propertyDescriptors.name: Stat3Name

propertyDescriptors.label: Stat #3 Order (higher values are applied first)
propertyDescriptors.name: Stat3Priority

propertyDescriptors.label: Stat #4 Name of stat to be changed
propertyDescriptors.name: Stat4Name

propertyDescriptors.label: Stat #4 Order (higher values are applied first)
propertyDescriptors.name: Stat4Priority
